items.sentence: I can\'t believe you don\'t want to at least look out the window.
I can\'t think of a single reason why we shouldn\'t go there now.
Tom made it clear that he didn\'t want to eat before the concert.
Tom said that he did nothing wrong and that it wasn\'t his fault.
We couldn\'t open the door because it was locked from the inside.
You can go out, as long as you promise to be back by 11 o\'clock.
Within a few minutes, Tom had eaten up all the food on the table.
I wonder whether or not Tom has told Mary she shouldn\'t do that.
When was the last time that you told your wife she was beautiful?
When was the last time you had to deal with this kind of problem?
It took Tom a few weeks to get used to working in his new office.
Oil has played an important part in the progress of civilization.
The teacher would only allow us to speak French in the classroom.
You were always good at getting Tom to do what you wanted him to.
I don\'t think we\'ll have any problem raising the money we need.
I was born in Boston, but I\'ve lived in Chicago most of my life.
Tom showed up at the party by himself, just like I knew he would.
Tom smothered Mary to death with a pillow while she was sleeping.
I know we\'ve had problems, but I think they\'ve all been solved.
It was a nice place to visit, but I wouldn\'t want to live there.
